Anglo European School, Ingatestone, Essex, CM4 0DJ

It is understood that the proposed development will comprise the demolition of some existing
school buildings, to be replaced with a new 3-storey main building. The works will also include
new access roads around the campus, new carpark areas and grassed social areas.

chemical_table_pages.preview:
SECTION 1
INTRODUCTION
• Undertaking of laboratory chemical and geotechnical testing upon samples obtained;
• Return ground gas/groundwater monitoring;
• The compilation of this report, which collects and discusses the above data, and presents
an assessment of the site conditions, conclusions and recommendations.
1.5 Previous/Supplied Documentation

DESK STUDY SUMMARY
Area Item Details
Controlled waters: Swimming pool and ponds on site.
The two ponds are present on site with a third just
outside the northern boundary close to the eastern-
most corner.
Tanks: Six gas-powered boiler rooms are present across
Buildings EFAA, EFAE, EFAG, EFAH, and EFAI, supplied
from a service box near the south-west entrance. All are
generally brick-bui

4 GROUND INVESTIGATION

a specification provided by the client. Exploratory hole locations were also specified by the
client. A site walkover and ground investigation photo plan is presented in Figure 3, Appendix
1.

SECTION 8
SOIL GAS RISK ASSESSMENT
8 SOIL GAS RISK ASSESSMENT
8.1 Soil Gas Results
8.1.1 Four return monitoring visits have been undertaken between 29 April 2025 and 20 May 2025,
to monitor wells installed within boreholes at the site for soil gas concentrations and
groundwater levels.
8.1.2 During the visits atmospheric pressure ranged between 1012mb and 1020mb and pressure
trends observed were b

SECTION 8
SOIL GAS RISK ASSESSMENT
8.2.5 The soil gas assessment method is based on that proposed by Wilson & Card (1999), which was
a development of a method proposed in CIRIA publication R149 (CIRIA, 1995). The method
uses both gas concentrations and borehole flow rates to define a characteristic situation based
on the limiting borehole gas volume flow for methane and carbon dioxide. In both the
